document.title: Maryland College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts Grades 6-8

924BBE884491447A982457D34634BE35.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade
appropriate general academic and domainspecific words and phrases; gather vocabulary
knowledge when considering a word or
phrase important to comprehension or
expression.

5FB70D8E0C7949498A2922190D306B86.description:
Distinguish among the
connotations (associations) of words with
similar denotations (definitions) (e.g.,
refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic,
condescending).

245D3B80850649AA97CA2E595FD87F69.description:
Use the relationship between
particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym,
analogy) to better understand each of the
words.

7B87366089D441FDBBA171CA81CA801A.description:
Interpret figures of speech (e.g.,
literary, biblical, and mythological
allusions) in context.

07758C4745A2429EB2DC7BD103A6B09F.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
figurative language, word relationships, and
nuances in word meanings.

2E767FE485124EE886A00633F8A0BD72.description:
Verify the preliminary
determination of the meaning of a word
or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred
meaning in context or in a dictionary).

A4ACFA233D9E4625B0D342C1E60AD959.description:
Consult general and specialized
reference materials (e.g., dictionaries,
glossaries, thesauruses), both print and
digital, to find the pronunciation of a
word or determine or clarify its precise
meaning or its part of speech.

209DA1D75D0C4A4B8403C584A85E06CC.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate
Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to
the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent,
bellicose, rebel).

A10A9D0EC0D242E4A21A95122BCFD655.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall
meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a
word's position or function in a sentence)
as a clue to the meaning of a word or
phrase.

B1FB96A90B8B4D86B8056E2A9F995952.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiple meaning words and
phrases based on grade 7 reading and
content, choosing flexibly from a range of
strategies.

F3F6B3563E934F839296B0F4CF217EF8.description:
Choose language that expresses
ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing
and eliminating wordiness and
redundancy. *

E0B151D9E9F9447BB312F81D5DBC37A3.description:
Use knowledge of language and its
conventions when writing, speaking, reading,
or listening.

F9CC6A863EA341E4ACE84687F64A9012.description:
Use a comma to separate
coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a
fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He
wore an old[,] green shirt).

8681BDA7F5D14B638604B8D3DB2C7892.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

3BF286E2BCC84E4A82BEED14CE3BB28D.description:
Place phrases and clauses within a
sentence, recognizing and correcting
misplaced and dangling modifiers. *

1126A7DEFA0144F38164F09679D32BBC.description:
Choose among simple, compound,
complex, and compound-complex
sentences to signal differing relationships
among ideas.

BB1D693503AC4174B14A0C36E5BB79F5.description:
Explain the function of phrases
and clauses in general and their function
in specific sentences.

BAF5FC36EE8641548047A00D2BCC2261.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English grammar and
usage when writing or speaking.

D6E7BEBAA2B344DFA62FA893D5901AC5.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts
and tasks, demonstrating command of formal
English when indicated or appropriate. (See
grade 7 Language standards 1 and 3for specific
expectations.)

25ED3B2C137C4F34BC92FD1277F78601.description:
Include multimedia components and
visual displays in presentations to clarify claims
and findings and emphasize salient points.

5BDC65D580844EEDBA50E05085C247C1.description:
Present claims and findings,
emphasizing salient points in a focused,
coherent manner with pertinent descriptions,
facts, details, and examples; use appropriate
eye contact, adequate volume, and clear
pronunciation.

93C626612B614A6E917E46A5503EB5D6.description:
Delineate a speaker's argument and
specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the
reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of
the evidence.

04A68FDD7E784C088BF9AEB6E6EA47FF.description:
Analyze the main ideas and supporting
details presented in diverse media and formats
(e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain
how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue
under study.

FD42C6404927425DB5E4CBB8943627CB.description:
Acknowledge new information
expressed by others and, when warranted,
modify their own views.

949A64A04ED34ACF8CFE0999C692D26D.description:
Pose questions that elicit
elaboration and respond to others'
questions and comments with relevant
observations and ideas that bring the
discussion back on topic as needed.

438413A289F444638DBF90F717001982.description:
Follow rules for collegial
discussions, track progress toward specific
goals and deadlines, and define individual
roles as needed.

236DDEB58A5849B4B2A575C81923907B.description:
Come to discussions prepared,
having read or researched material under
study; explicitly draw on that preparation
by referring to evidence on the topic, text,
or issue to probe and reflect on ideas
under discussion.

EE1BF5DC4BAB471DB08D4AFC6E3ED1C9.description:
Engage effectively in a range of
collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in
groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners
on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on
others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

E76E8EBE0C3F4CFBBF3F35A9ECF0F265.description:
Write routinely over extended time
frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single
sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

8ECB2229A1374699AADAB959D5AA075A.description:
Apply grade 7 Reading standards
to literary nonfiction (e.g. "Trace and
evaluate the argument and specific claims
in a text, assessing whether the reasoning
is sound and the evidence is relevant and
sufficient to support the claims").

31B53517520349F3A62FC075573D9953.description:
Apply grade 7 Reading standards
to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast
a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or
character and a historical account of the
same period as a means of understanding
how authors of fiction use or alter
history").

7188126894F84257BAB2D5DD18AB27F1.description:
Draw evidence from literary or
informational texts to support analysis,
reflection, and research.

37338F95E7B34C9797BD76102F4BFCE5.description:
Gather relevant information from
multiple print and digital sources, using search
terms effectively; assess the credibility and
accuracy of each source; and quote or
paraphrase the data and conclusions of others
while avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation.

B269501F94894289861416FA8E7FB810.description:
Conduct short research projects to
answer a question, drawing on several sources
and generating additional related, focused
questions for further research and
investigation.

CD1D5B06A22F4D73808D164096BD4915.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

133F6399083745219BDFAE969EBE8694.description:
Use technology, including the Internet,
to produce and publish writing and link to and
cite sources as well as to interact and
collaborate with others, including linking to
and citing sources.

0D2377EAAB084D2796420C3345DBF71B.description:
With some guidance and support from
peers and adults, develop and strengthen
writing as needed by planning, revising,
editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach,
focusing on how well purpose and audience
have been addressed. (Editing for conventions
should demonstrate command of Language
standards 1-3 up to and including grade 7.)

5E6447FE244A4823B49242F4B3CD5E0D.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in
which the development, organization, and
style are appropriate to task, purpose, and
audience. (Grade-specific expectations for
writing types are defined in standards 1-3
above.)

DD2796CB47ED46609ED3A50556501BEF.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows
from and reflects on the narrated
experiences or events.

0CEFAB03A7574D84BA37478F73A7F7C6.description:
Use precise words and phrases,
relevant descriptive details, and sensory
language to capture the action and
convey experiences and events.

653EA80ECFAD4FF2AAC06CD5E4E8472D.description:
Use a variety of transition words,
phrases, and clauses to convey sequence
and signal shifts from one time frame or
setting to another.

A9AC9F7597DD4C72BC07BD2B68199155.description:
Use narrative techniques, such
as dialogue, pacing, and description, to
develop experiences, events, and/or
characters.

4C682054483D4232967171051AECBDA3.description:
Engage and orient the reader by
establishing a context and point of view
and introducing a narrator and/or
characters; organize an event sequence
that unfolds naturally and logically.

954F6490398B4B0FB4C4FEE6AD25798E.description:
Write narratives to develop real or
imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, relevant descriptive details, and
well-structured event sequences.

D4EB4E637BC14F999408AC73B2D82466.description:
Provide a concluding statement
or section that follows from and supports
the information or explanation presented

80F3CBDF182147C1A7334DB6C1DB1EAB.description:
Establish and maintain a formal
style.

CE2EB8AF40894FB1B41682168C618656.description:
Use precise language and
domain-specific vocabulary to inform
about or explain the topic.

789E074DB65F46CAB0F045F42915E3E1.description:
Use appropriate transitions to
create cohesion and clarify the
relationships among ideas and concepts.

2AB60657C39E4BA2B144FDA2CE75E505.description:
Develop the topic with relevant
facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, or other information and
examples.

2FF84C9EE3CF497583F67DC0C5DBB79C.description:
Introduce a topic clearly,
previewing what is to follow; organize
ideas, concepts, and information, using
strategies such as definition, classification,
comparison/contrast, and cause/effect;
include formatting (e.g., headings),
graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and
multimedia when useful to aiding
comprehension.

561E1C7BEA70470E874AB91E069B04A0.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to
examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts,
and information through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

82FEBB24E1754B2B8D5D81A083D76B1A.description:
Provide a concluding statement
or section that follows from and supports
the argument presented.

D27A26EE644445B0B3874A8B513CCF52.description:
Establish and maintain a formal
style.

F7CDEF32C1AE4B8FB374066E248A3599.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses
to create cohesion and clarify the
relationships among claim(s), reasons,
and evidence.

3EE282A3A4ED4AD4BB6714E1592D21A4.description:
Support claim(s) with logical
reasoning and relevant evidence, using
accurate, credible sources and
demonstrating an understanding of the
topic or text.

4D1A91854B3F48A39192B4FECC2BFA47.description:
Introduce claim(s), acknowledge
alternate or opposing claims, and
organize the reasons and evidence
logically.

4E35EECB15A74E499789D156CC0EDBBD.description:
Write arguments to support claims with
clear reasons and relevant evidence.

AF3701F2C4DE404CA42E7103835D77E7.description:
By the end of the year, read and
comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-
8 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the
range.

25C2F4D25EAB4D8799AAD5E3BC739A83.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BBD2700E472C43B99154198E997DF429.description:
Analyze how two or more authors
writing about the same topic shape their
presentations of key information by
emphasizing different evidence or advancing
different interpretations of facts.

99BCCDC75D144FAF8D6F84AB7444494E.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and
specific claims in a text, assessing whether the
reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant
and sufficient to support the claims.

B5569D7D34964527B740B6DCA24C72F6.description:
Compare and contrast a text to an
audio, video, or multimedia version of the text,
analyzing each medium's portrayal of the
subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech
affects the impact of the words).

D19C2334CF9B4534AD87D7D8A5AAB75B.description:
Determine an author's point of view or
purpose in a text and analyze how the author
distinguishes his or her position from that of
others.

B7065124E03B49AF86E11A19C64E7FA5.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to
organize a text, including how the major
sections contribute to the whole and to the
development of the ideas.

97861F135EC84E0E925EB04F48EBBB28.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative, connotative, and technical
meanings; analyze the impact of a specific
word choice on meaning and tone.

3AEB1CA842AA4F5AA95CD4E68B1DDBF9.description:
Analyze the interactions between
individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g.,
how ideas influence individuals or events, or
how individuals influence ideas or events)

2CFCC0D9F7FE49FC9B59597ECBBECB69.description:
Determine two or more central ideas in
a text and analyze their development over the
course of the text; provide an objective
summary of the text.

D780DB4E57374B3CA1CDA1BCD0381843.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence to
support analysis of what the text says explicitly
as well as inferences drawn from the text.

B5D18DA8C2F74473BCE30A9B3FAEA934.description:
By the end of the year, read and
comprehend literature, including stories,
dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text
complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding
as needed at the high end of the range.

E8BC331F03C0455FAE26B66210D2B654.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

138DD429267D42999474C74CC952C37D.description:
Compare and contrast a fictional
portrayal of a time, place, or character and a
historical account of the same period as a
means of understanding how authors of fiction
use or alter history.

20950A293DFC4F58BB538CFA614485D0.description:
Compare and contrast a written story,
drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or
multimedia version, analyzing the effects of
techniques unique to each medium (e.g.,
lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and
angles in a film).

3332F11EFDE54182BA35C92029CCAF17.description:
Analyze how an author develops and
contrasts the points of view of different
characters or narrators in a text.

1343E0FF098043339D3B12DC1DCDA16B.description:
Analyze how a drama's or poem's form
or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet)
contributes to its meaning.

C4BD6F184D4441248285A941D5F8E1E5.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative and connotative meanings; analyze
the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of
sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or
stanza of a poem or section of a story or
drama.

DDB99A1E6164405CB2724CF2027E46F1.description:
Analyze how particular elements of a
story or drama interact (e.g., how setting
shapes the characters or plot).

BD340207BA7A4B62AE6E67ACB8587596.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a
text and analyze its development over the
course of the text; provide an objective
summary of the text.

571E7672122E4B46BB6F5CEDF2E79F56.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence
to support analysis of what the text says
explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the
text.
